definition: to dare to be first/to pioneer (idiom)
to dare/daring/(polite) may I venture
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
early/prior/former/in advance/first

sentences.english: You have quite a pioneering spirit and are willing to tackle any project that comes your way.
sentences.chinese: 敢为人先的你愿意去解决任何困难。

definition: creativity
enterprising spirit/pioneering spirit
to tackle a thorny problem and overcome its challenges
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
to strive unremittingly/self-improvement
to develop/to make full use of
proactive
fortitude
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to advance bravely/to endeavor
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
(idiom) not want to be outdone/not content to lag behind
to struggle arduously
